column4: I know, that is what I have right now XUbuntu - I am considering running a "sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop", which would install Gnome, since it is a metapackage of 774 megs, and cannot be uninstalled - I want to know, how much more CPU power on average does GNOME steal?
Last time I remember Gnome it was pretty harsh on the resources, but not as bad as KDE, KDE is a resource hog./
Yes, KDE is pretty heavy...on the other hand it also does quite a lot, so I guess there's a tradeoff :>
Yeah, but I enjoy building my own system up :) KDE robs all that fun away from me :))
